026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.taglets;
027
028import java.io.File;
029import java.io.IOException;
030import java.io.PrintStream;
031import java.util.ArrayList;
032import java.util.EnumMap;
033import java.util.EnumSet;
034import java.util.HashSet;
035import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
036import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
037import java.util.List;
038import java.util.Map;
039import java.util.ServiceLoader;
040import java.util.Set;
041import java.util.TreeMap;
042
043import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
044import javax.lang.model.element.ExecutableElement;
045import javax.lang.model.element.ModuleElement;
046import javax.lang.model.element.PackageElement;
047import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
048import javax.lang.model.element.VariableElement;
049import javax.lang.model.util.SimpleElementVisitor14;
050import javax.tools.JavaFileManager;
051import javax.tools.StandardJavaFileManager;
052
053import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.BaseConfiguration;
054import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.BaseOptions;
055import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.DocletElement;
056import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.Messages;
057import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.Resources;
058import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.CommentHelper;
059import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.Utils;
060
061import com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree;
062
063import jdk.javadoc.doclet.Doclet;
064import jdk.javadoc.doclet.DocletEnvironment;
065import jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet.Location;
066
067import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.AUTHOR;
068import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.EXCEPTION;
069import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.HIDDEN;
070import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.LINK;
071import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.LINK_PLAIN;
072import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.PARAM;
073import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.PROVIDES;
074import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.SEE;
075import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.SERIAL;
076import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.SERIAL_DATA;
077import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.SERIAL_FIELD;
078import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.SINCE;
079import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.THROWS;
080import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.USES;
081import static com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree.Kind.VERSION;
082import static javax.tools.DocumentationTool.Location.TAGLET_PATH;
083
084/**
085 * Manages the {@code Taglet}s used by doclets.
086 */
087public class TagletManager {
088
089    /**
090     * All taglets, keyed either by their {@link Taglet#getName() name},
091     * or by an alias.
092     *
093     * In general, taglets do <i>not</i> provide aliases;
094     * the one instance that does is {@code ThrowsTaglet}, which handles
095     * both {@code @throws} tags and {@code @exception} tags.
096     */
097    private final LinkedHashMap<String, Taglet> allTaglets;
098
099    /**
100     * Block (non-inline) taglets, grouped by {@link Location location}.
101     */
102    private Map<Location, List<Taglet>> blockTagletsByLocation;
103
104    /**
105     * The taglets that can appear inline in descriptive text.
106     */
107    private Map<String, Taglet> inlineTags;
108
109    /**
110     * The taglets that can appear in the serialized form.
111     */
112    private List<Taglet> serializedFormTags;
113
114    private final DocletEnvironment docEnv;
115    private final Doclet doclet;
116
117    private final Utils utils;
118    private final Messages messages;
119    private final Resources resources;
120
121    /**
122     * Keep track of standard tags.
123     */
124    private final Set<String> standardTags;
125
126    /**
127     * Keep track of standard tags in lowercase to compare for better
128     * error messages when a tag like {@code @docRoot} is mistakenly spelled
129     * lowercase {@code @docroot}.
130     */
131    private final Set<String> standardTagsLowercase;
132
133    /**
134     * Keep track of overridden standard tags.
135     */
136    private final Set<String> overriddenStandardTags;
137
138    /**
139     * Keep track of the tags that may conflict
140     * with standard tags in the future (any custom tag without
141     * a period in its name).
142     */
143    private final Set<String> potentiallyConflictingTags;
144
145    /**
146     * The set of unseen custom tags.
147     */
148    private final Set<String> unseenCustomTags;
149
150    /**
151     * True if we do not want to use {@code @since} tags.
152     */
153    private final boolean nosince;
154
155    /**
156     * True if we want to use {@code @version} tags.
157     */
158    private final boolean showversion;
159
160    /**
161     * True if we want to use {@code @author} tags.
162     */
163    private final boolean showauthor;
164
165    /**
166     * True if we want to use JavaFX-related tags ({@code @defaultValue}, {@code @treatAsPrivate}).
167     */
168    private final boolean javafx;
169
170    /**
171     * Show the taglets table when it has been initialized.
172     */
173    private final boolean showTaglets;
174
175    private final String tagletPath;
176
177    private final BaseConfiguration configuration;
178
179    /**
180     * Constructs a new {@code TagletManager}.
181     *
182     * @param configuration the configuration for this taglet manager
183     */
184    public TagletManager(BaseConfiguration configuration) {
185        overriddenStandardTags = new HashSet<>();
186        potentiallyConflictingTags = new HashSet<>();
187        standardTags = new HashSet<>();
188        standardTagsLowercase = new HashSet<>();
189        unseenCustomTags = new HashSet<>();
190        allTaglets = new LinkedHashMap<>();
191        this.configuration = configuration;
192        BaseOptions options = configuration.getOptions();
193        this.nosince = options.noSince();
194        this.showversion = options.showVersion();
195        this.showauthor = options.showAuthor();
196        this.javafx = options.javafx();
197        this.docEnv = configuration.docEnv;
198        this.doclet = configuration.doclet;
199        this.messages = configuration.getMessages();
200        this.resources = configuration.getDocResources();
201        this.showTaglets = options.showTaglets();
202        this.utils = configuration.utils;
203        this.tagletPath = options.tagletPath();
204        initStandardTaglets();
205    }
206
207    public Set<String> getAllTagletNames() {
208        return allTaglets.keySet();
209    }
210
211    /**
212     * Initializes the location TAGLET_PATH which is used to locate the custom taglets.
213     *
214     * @param fileManager the file manager to load classes and resources
215     * @throws IOException if an error occurs while setting the location
216     */
217    public void initTagletPath(JavaFileManager fileManager) throws IOException {
218        if (fileManager instanceof StandardJavaFileManager sfm) {
219            if (tagletPath != null) {
220                List<File> paths = new ArrayList<>();
221                for (String pathname : tagletPath.split(File.pathSeparator)) {
222                    paths.add(new File(pathname));
223                }
224                sfm.setLocation(TAGLET_PATH, paths);
225            } else if (!sfm.hasLocation(TAGLET_PATH)) {
226                sfm.setLocation(TAGLET_PATH, List.of());
227            }
228        } else if (tagletPath != null) {
229            messages.error("doclet.not_standard_file_manager");
230        }
231    }
232
233    /**
234     * Adds a new {@code Taglet}.
235     *
236     * Prints a message to indicate whether or not the Taglet was registered properly.
237     *
238     * @param classname  the name of the class representing the custom tag
239     * @param fileManager the file manager to load classes and resources
240     */
241    public void addCustomTag(String classname, JavaFileManager fileManager) {
242        ClassLoader tagClassLoader = fileManager.getClassLoader(TAGLET_PATH);
243        if (configuration.workArounds.accessInternalAPI()) {
244            Module thisModule = getClass().getModule();
245            Module tagletLoaderUnnamedModule
246                = tagClassLoader.getUnnamedModule();
247            List<String> pkgs = List.of(
248                "jdk.javadoc.doclet",
249                "org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit",
250                "org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html");
251            pkgs.forEach(
252                p -> thisModule.addOpens(p, tagletLoaderUnnamedModule));
253        }
254        try {
255            Class<? extends jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet> customTagClass
256                = tagClassLoader.loadClass(classname)
257                    .asSubclass(jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet.class);
258            jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet instance
259                = customTagClass.getConstructor().newInstance();
260            registerTaglet(instance);
261        } catch (ReflectiveOperationException | ExceptionInInitializerError
262                | ClassCastException exc) {
263            messages.error("doclet.Error_taglet_not_registered",
264                exc.getClass().getName(),
265                classname);
266        }
267    }
268
269    /**
270     * Loads taglets from a taglet path using the service loader.
271     *
272     * @param fileManager the file manager to load the taglets
273     * @throws IOException if an error occurs while getting the service loader
274     */
275    public void loadTaglets(JavaFileManager fileManager) throws IOException {
276        Iterable<? extends File> location
277            = ((StandardJavaFileManager) fileManager).getLocation(TAGLET_PATH);
278        if (location != null && location.iterator().hasNext()) {
279            ServiceLoader<jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet> serviceLoader = fileManager
280                .getServiceLoader(TAGLET_PATH, jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet.class);
281            for (jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet taglet : serviceLoader) {
282                registerTaglet(taglet);
283            }
284        }
285    }
286
287    /**
288     * Registers the {@code Taglet}.
289     *
290     * Prints a message if the {@code Taglet} got registered properly.
291     *
292     * @param instance the {@code Taglet} instance
293     */
294    private void registerTaglet(jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet instance) {
295        instance.init(docEnv, doclet);
296        Taglet newLegacy = new UserTaglet(instance);
297        allTaglets.put(newLegacy.getName(), newLegacy);
298        messages.notice("doclet.Notice_taglet_registered",
299            instance.getClass().getName());
300    }
301
302    /**
303     * Adds a new {@code SimpleTaglet}.
304     *
305     * If this tag already exists and the header passed as an argument is {@code null},
306     * move tag to the back of the list. If this tag already exists and the
307     * header passed as an argument is not {@code null}, overwrite previous tag
308     * with the new one. Otherwise, add a new SimpleTaglet to the list.
309     *
310     * @param tagName the name of this tag
311     * @param header the header to output
312     * @param locations the possible locations that this tag can appear in
313     */
314    public void addNewSimpleCustomTag(String tagName, String header,
315            String locations) {
316        if (tagName == null || locations == null) {
317            return;
318        }
319        // remove + put in both branches below move the tag to the back of the
320        // map's ordering
321        Taglet tag = allTaglets.remove(tagName);
322        if (tag == null || header != null) {
323            allTaglets.put(tagName,
324                new SimpleTaglet(tagName, header, locations));
325            if (Utils.toLowerCase(locations).indexOf('x') == -1) {
326                checkTagName(tagName);
327            }
328        } else {
329            // Move existing tag to the back
330            allTaglets.put(tagName, tag);
331        }
332    }
333
334    /**
335     * Given a tag name, add it to the set of tags it belongs to.
336     */
337    private void checkTagName(String name) {
338        if (standardTags.contains(name)) {
339            overriddenStandardTags.add(name);
340        } else {
341            if (name.indexOf('.') == -1) {
342                potentiallyConflictingTags.add(name);
343            }
344            unseenCustomTags.add(name);
345        }
346    }
347
348    /**
349     * Reports that a tag was seen in a doc comment.
350     * It is removed from the list of custom tags that have not yet been seen.
351     *
352     * @param name the name of the tag
353     */
354    void seenTag(String name) {
355        unseenCustomTags.remove(name);
356    }
357
358    /**
359     * Given a series of {@code DocTree}s, check for misuse and spelling mistakes.
360     *
361     * @param element the tags holder
362     * @param trees the trees containing the comments
363     */
364    public void checkTags(Element element, Iterable<? extends DocTree> trees) {
365        CommentHelper ch = utils.getCommentHelper(element);
366        for (DocTree tag : trees) {
367            String name = tag.getKind().tagName;
368            if (name == null) {
369                continue;
370            }
371            if (!name.isEmpty() && name.charAt(0) == '@') {
372                name = name.substring(1);
373            }
374            if (!(standardTags.contains(name)
375                || allTaglets.containsKey(name))) {
376                if (standardTagsLowercase.contains(Utils.toLowerCase(name))) {
377                    messages.warning(ch.getDocTreePath(tag),
378                        "doclet.UnknownTagLowercase", ch.getTagName(tag));
379                    continue;
380                } else {
381                    messages.warning(ch.getDocTreePath(tag),
382                        "doclet.UnknownTag", ch.getTagName(tag));
383                    continue;
384                }
385            }
386            final Taglet taglet = allTaglets.get(name);
387            // Check and verify tag usage
388            if (taglet != null) {
389                if (taglet instanceof SimpleTaglet st && !st.enabled) {
390                    // taglet has been disabled
391                    return;
392                }
393
394                new SimpleElementVisitor14<Void, Void>() {
395                    @Override
396                    public Void visitModule(ModuleElement e, Void p) {
397                        if (!taglet.inModule()) {
398                            printTagMisuseWarn(utils.getCommentHelper(e),
399                                taglet, tag, "module");
400                        }
401                        return null;
402                    }
403
404                    @Override
405                    public Void visitPackage(PackageElement e, Void p) {
406                        if (!taglet.inPackage()) {
407                            printTagMisuseWarn(utils.getCommentHelper(e),
408                                taglet, tag, "package");
409                        }
410                        return null;
411                    }
412
413                    @Override
414                    public Void visitType(TypeElement e, Void p) {
415                        if (!taglet.inType()) {
416                            printTagMisuseWarn(utils.getCommentHelper(e),
417                                taglet, tag, "class");
418                        }
419                        return null;
420                    }
421
422                    @Override
423                    public Void visitExecutable(ExecutableElement e, Void p) {
424                        if (utils.isConstructor(e) && !taglet.inConstructor()) {
425                            printTagMisuseWarn(utils.getCommentHelper(e),
426                                taglet, tag, "constructor");
427                        } else if (!taglet.inMethod()) {
428                            printTagMisuseWarn(utils.getCommentHelper(e),
429                                taglet, tag, "method");
430                        }
431                        return null;
432                    }
433
434                    @Override
435                    public Void visitVariable(VariableElement e, Void p) {
436                        if (utils.isField(e) && !taglet.inField()) {
437                            printTagMisuseWarn(utils.getCommentHelper(e),
438                                taglet, tag, "field");
439                        }
440                        return null;
441                    }
442
443                    @Override
444                    public Void visitUnknown(Element e, Void p) {
445                        if (utils.isOverviewElement(e)
446                            && !taglet.inOverview()) {
447                            printTagMisuseWarn(utils.getCommentHelper(e),
448                                taglet, tag, "overview");
449                        }
450                        return null;
451                    }
452
453                    @Override
454                    protected Void defaultAction(Element e, Void p) {
455                        return null;
456                    }
457                }.visit(element);
458            }
459        }
460    }
461
462    /**
463     * Given the taglet, the tag and the type of documentation that the tag
464     * was found in, print a tag misuse warning.
465     *
466     * @param taglet the taglet representing the misused tag
467     * @param tag the misused tag
468     * @param holderType the type of documentation that the misused tag was found in
469     */
470    private void printTagMisuseWarn(CommentHelper ch, Taglet taglet,
471            DocTree tag, String holderType) {
472        Set<String> locationsSet = new LinkedHashSet<>();
473        // The following names should be localized
474        if (taglet.inOverview()) {
475            locationsSet.add("overview");
476        }
477        if (taglet.inModule()) {
478            locationsSet.add("module");
479        }
480        if (taglet.inPackage()) {
481            locationsSet.add("package");
482        }
483        if (taglet.inType()) {
484            locationsSet.add("class/interface");
485        }
486        if (taglet.inConstructor()) {
487            locationsSet.add("constructor");
488        }
489        if (taglet.inField()) {
490            locationsSet.add("field");
491        }
492        if (taglet.inMethod()) {
493            locationsSet.add("method");
494        }
495        if (locationsSet.isEmpty()) {
496            // This known tag is excluded.
497            return;
498        }
499        var combined_locations = String.join(", ", locationsSet);
500        messages.warning(ch.getDocTreePath(tag), "doclet.tag_misuse",
501            "@" + taglet.getName(), holderType, combined_locations);
502    }
503
504    /**
505     * Returns the taglets that can appear inline, in descriptive text.
506     * @return the taglets that can appear inline
507     */
508    Map<String, Taglet> getInlineTaglets() {
509        if (inlineTags == null) {
510            initTaglets();
511        }
512        return inlineTags;
513    }
514
515    /**
516     * Returns the taglets that can appear in the serialized form.
517     * @return the taglet that can appear in the serialized form
518     */
519    public List<Taglet> getSerializedFormTaglets() {
520        if (serializedFormTags == null) {
521            initTaglets();
522        }
523        return serializedFormTags;
524    }
525
526    /**
527     * Returns the custom tags for a given element.
528     *
529     * @param e the element to get custom tags for
530     * @return the array of {@code Taglet}s that can
531     * appear in the given element
532     */
533    @SuppressWarnings("fallthrough")
534    public List<Taglet> getBlockTaglets(Element e) {
535        if (blockTagletsByLocation == null) {
536            initTaglets();
537        }
538
539        switch (e.getKind()) {
540        case CONSTRUCTOR:
541            return blockTagletsByLocation.get(Location.CONSTRUCTOR);
542        case METHOD:
543            return blockTagletsByLocation.get(Location.METHOD);
544        case ENUM_CONSTANT:
545        case FIELD:
546            return blockTagletsByLocation.get(Location.FIELD);
547        case ANNOTATION_TYPE:
548        case INTERFACE:
549        case CLASS:
550        case ENUM:
551        case RECORD:
552            return blockTagletsByLocation.get(Location.TYPE);
553        case MODULE:
554            return blockTagletsByLocation.get(Location.MODULE);
555        case PACKAGE:
556            return blockTagletsByLocation.get(Location.PACKAGE);
557        case OTHER:
558            if (e instanceof DocletElement de) {
559                switch (de.getSubKind()) {
560                case DOCFILE:
561                    return blockTagletsByLocation.get(Location.PACKAGE);
562                case OVERVIEW:
563                    return blockTagletsByLocation.get(Location.OVERVIEW);
564                default:
565                    // fall through
566                }
567            }
568            // fall through
569        default:
570            throw new AssertionError(
571                "unknown element: " + e + " ,kind: " + e.getKind());
572        }
573    }
574
575    /**
576     * Initialize the tag collections.
577     */
578    private void initTaglets() {
579
580        blockTagletsByLocation = new EnumMap<>(Location.class);
581        for (Location site : Location.values()) {
582            blockTagletsByLocation.put(site, new ArrayList<>());
583        }
584
585        inlineTags = new LinkedHashMap<>();
586
587        allTaglets.forEach((name, t) -> {
588            if (t.isInlineTag()) {
589                inlineTags.put(t.getName(), t);
590            }
591
592            if (t.isBlockTag() && t.getName().equals(name)) {
593                t.getAllowedLocations()
594                    .forEach(l -> blockTagletsByLocation.get(l).add(t));
595            }
596        });
597
598        // init the serialized form tags for the serialized form page
599        serializedFormTags = new ArrayList<>();
600        serializedFormTags.add(allTaglets.get(SERIAL_DATA.tagName));
601        serializedFormTags.add(allTaglets.get(PARAM.tagName));
602        serializedFormTags.add(allTaglets.get(THROWS.tagName));
603        if (!nosince)
604            serializedFormTags.add(allTaglets.get(SINCE.tagName));
605        serializedFormTags.add(allTaglets.get(SEE.tagName));
606
607        if (showTaglets) {
608            showTaglets(System.out);
609        }
610    }
611
612    /**
613     * Initialize standard Javadoc tags for ordering purposes.
614     */
615    private void initStandardTaglets() {
616        if (javafx) {
617            initJavaFXTaglets();
618        }
619
620        addStandardTaglet(new ParamTaglet());
621        addStandardTaglet(new ReturnTaglet());
622        addStandardTaglet(new ThrowsTaglet(configuration), EXCEPTION);
623        addStandardTaglet(
624            new SimpleTaglet(SINCE, resources.getText("doclet.Since"),
625                EnumSet.allOf(Location.class), !nosince));
626        addStandardTaglet(
627            new SimpleTaglet(VERSION, resources.getText("doclet.Version"),
628                EnumSet.of(Location.OVERVIEW, Location.MODULE, Location.PACKAGE,
629                    Location.TYPE),
630                showversion));
631        addStandardTaglet(
632            new SimpleTaglet(AUTHOR, resources.getText("doclet.Author"),
633                EnumSet.of(Location.OVERVIEW, Location.MODULE, Location.PACKAGE,
634                    Location.TYPE),
635                showauthor));
636        addStandardTaglet(
637            new SimpleTaglet(SERIAL_DATA,
638                resources.getText("doclet.SerialData"),
639                EnumSet.noneOf(Location.class)));
640        addStandardTaglet(
641            new SimpleTaglet(HIDDEN, null,
642                EnumSet.of(Location.TYPE, Location.METHOD, Location.FIELD)));
643
644        // This appears to be a default custom (non-standard) taglet
645        Taglet factoryTaglet
646            = new SimpleTaglet("factory", resources.getText("doclet.Factory"),
647                EnumSet.of(Location.METHOD));
648        allTaglets.put(factoryTaglet.getName(), factoryTaglet);
649
650        addStandardTaglet(new SeeTaglet());
651        addStandardTaglet(new SpecTaglet());
652
653        // Standard inline tags
654        addStandardTaglet(new DocRootTaglet());
655        addStandardTaglet(new InheritDocTaglet());
656        addStandardTaglet(new ValueTaglet());
657        addStandardTaglet(new LiteralTaglet());
658        addStandardTaglet(new CodeTaglet());
659        addStandardTaglet(new SnippetTaglet());
660        addStandardTaglet(new IndexTaglet());
661        addStandardTaglet(new SummaryTaglet());
662        addStandardTaglet(new SystemPropertyTaglet());
663
664        // Keep track of the names of standard tags for error checking purposes.
665        // The following are not handled above.
666        addStandardTaglet(new DeprecatedTaglet());
667        addStandardTaglet(
668            new BaseTaglet(LINK, true, EnumSet.allOf(Location.class)));
669        addStandardTaglet(
670            new BaseTaglet(LINK_PLAIN, true, EnumSet.allOf(Location.class)));
671        addStandardTaglet(
672            new BaseTaglet(USES, false, EnumSet.of(Location.MODULE)));
673        addStandardTaglet(
674            new BaseTaglet(PROVIDES, false, EnumSet.of(Location.MODULE)));
675        addStandardTaglet(
676            new SimpleTaglet(SERIAL, null,
677                EnumSet.of(Location.PACKAGE, Location.TYPE, Location.FIELD)));
678        addStandardTaglet(
679            new SimpleTaglet(SERIAL_FIELD, null, EnumSet.of(Location.FIELD)));
680    }
681
682    /**
683     * Initialize JavaFX-related tags.
684     */
685    private void initJavaFXTaglets() {
686        addStandardTaglet(new SimpleTaglet("propertyDescription",
687            resources.getText("doclet.PropertyDescription"),
688            EnumSet.of(Location.METHOD, Location.FIELD)));
689        addStandardTaglet(new SimpleTaglet("defaultValue",
690            resources.getText("doclet.DefaultValue"),
691            EnumSet.of(Location.METHOD, Location.FIELD)));
692        addStandardTaglet(new SimpleTaglet("treatAsPrivate", null,
693            EnumSet.of(Location.TYPE, Location.METHOD, Location.FIELD)));
694    }
695
696    private void addStandardTaglet(Taglet taglet) {
697        String name = taglet.getName();
698        allTaglets.put(name, taglet);
699        standardTags.add(name);
700        standardTagsLowercase.add(Utils.toLowerCase(name));
701    }
702
703    private void addStandardTaglet(Taglet taglet, DocTree.Kind alias) {
704        addStandardTaglet(taglet);
705        String name = alias.tagName;
706        allTaglets.put(name, taglet);
707        standardTags.add(name);
708        standardTagsLowercase.add(Utils.toLowerCase(name));
709    }
710
711    public boolean isKnownCustomTag(String tagName) {
712        return allTaglets.containsKey(tagName);
713    }
714
715    /**
716     * Print a list of {@link Taglet}s that might conflict with
717     * standard tags in the future and a list of standard tags
718     * that have been overridden.
719     */
720    public void printReport() {
721        printReportHelper("doclet.Notice_taglet_conflict_warn",
722            potentiallyConflictingTags);
723        printReportHelper("doclet.Notice_taglet_overridden",
724            overriddenStandardTags);
725        printReportHelper("doclet.Notice_taglet_unseen", unseenCustomTags);
726    }
727
728    private void printReportHelper(String noticeKey, Set<String> names) {
729        if (!names.isEmpty()) {
730            StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder();
731            for (String name : names) {
732                result.append(result.length() == 0 ? " " : ", ");
733                result.append("@").append(name);
734            }
735            messages.notice(noticeKey, result);
736        }
737    }
738
739    /**
740     * Given the name of a tag, return the corresponding taglet.
741     *
742     * @param name the name of the taglet to retrieve
743     * @return the corresponding taglet or {@code null} if the tag is unknown
744     */
745    Taglet getTaglet(String name) {
746        if (name.indexOf("@") == 0) {
747            return allTaglets.get(name.substring(1));
748        } else {
749            return allTaglets.get(name);
750        }
751    }
752
753    /*
754     * The output of this method is the basis for a table at the end of the
755     * doc comment specification, so any changes in the output may indicate
756     * a need for a corresponding update to the spec.
757     */
758    private void showTaglets(PrintStream out) {
759        Map<String, Taglet> taglets = new TreeMap<>(allTaglets);
760
761        taglets.forEach((n, t) -> {
762            // give preference to simpler block form if a tag can be either
763            String name = t.isBlockTag() ? "@" + n : "{@" + n + "}";
764            out.println(String.format("%20s", name) + ": "
765                + format(t.isBlockTag(), "block") + " "
766                + format(t.inOverview(), "overview") + " "
767                + format(t.inModule(), "module") + " "
768                + format(t.inPackage(), "package") + " "
769                + format(t.inType(), "type") + " "
770                + format(t.inConstructor(), "constructor") + " "
771                + format(t.inMethod(), "method") + " "
772                + format(t.inField(), "field") + " "
773                + format(t.isInlineTag(), "inline") + " "
774                + format((t instanceof SimpleTaglet st) && !st.enabled,
775                    "disabled"));
776        });
777    }
778
779    private String format(boolean b, String s) {
780        return b ? s : ".".repeat(s.length()); // "replace" all with "."
781    }
782}
